PC Number: 2003-0622

Date: 2003-05-02

                                                                                               (T.B. Rec. 830517)

                      Whereas the Siksika Nation is a recognized band as defined in the Indian Act;

 

                      Whereas the Siksika Nation submitted a specific claim to Canada in 1960 concerning the validity of a surrender in 1910;

 

                      Whereas Canada and the Siksika Nation agreed to sever the acreage discrepancy claim from the surrender claim in 1990 and both parties agreed to negotiate that portion of the acreage discrepancy claim dealing with the surface;

 

                      Whereas Canada, without admitting liability on the claim, has agreed to enter into a settlement agreement;

 

                      Whereas the Siksika Nation and Canada wish to implement the terms, conditions and procedures set forth in the settlement agreement;

 

                      Whereas, in accordance with the ratification guidelines, a ratification vote was held on February 4 and February 5, 2003 to consider the settlement agreement and the absolute surrender of all rights and interests to the lands described in article 5 of the settlement agreement, pursuant to paragraph 38(1) and sections 39 and 40 of the Indian Act, and a majority of the eligible voters of the Siksika Nation voted and a majority of these voters approved the proposed settlement agreement and the absolute surrender and authorized the Chief and Council of the Siksika Nation to enter into the settlement agreement;

 

                      And whereas the Siksika Nation / Canada Settlement Agreement was executed by the Chief and Council in accordance with the majority vote of the eligible voters;

 

 


                      Therefore, Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Indian Affairs and Northern Development and the Treasury Board, hereby:

 

(a) authorizes the Minister of Indian Affairs and Northern Development to enter into the Siksika Nation / Canada Settlement Agreement, attached hereto as Schedule “A”, on behalf of Her Majesty in right of Canada; and

 

(b) pursuant to paragraph 38(1) and sections 39 and 40 of the Indian Act, accepts the absolute surrender of all rights and interests to the lands referred to in article 5 of the agreement.
